item.title: My First Post
item.description: 1 print('hello world') There are two common models of conceptualizing the risk associated with a stock: Stock price return volatility (either empirical or implied) Graham’s notion of “margin of safety” i.e., the difference between a stock’s price and its intrinsic value The latter can be characterized as an informal assessment of how much downside risk is associated with a stock. In other words, it’s a consideration of the potential losses if an investor’s thesis is incorrect and/or if the worst case scenario is realized.
